Generation I.Red: Its boulder-like body is extremely hard. It can easily withstand dynamite blasts without damage.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: Its boulder-like body is extremely hard. It can easily withstand dynamite blasts without damage.
Generation I.Yellow: Once it sheds its skin, its body turns tender and whitish. Its hide hardens when it's exposed to air.
Generation I.Stadium: Its body, which weighs over 660 pounds , is as hard as stone. It grows bigger by shedding its skin once a year.

Generation II.Gold: It sheds its skin once a year. The discarded shell immediately hardens and crumbles away.
Generation II.Silver: It is capable of blowing itself up. It uses this explosive force to jump from mountain to mountain.
Generation II.Crystal: Its rock-like body is so durable, even high-powered dynamite blasts fail to scratch its rugged hide.
Generation II.Stadium 2: It sheds its skin once a year. The discarded shell immediately hardens and crumbles away. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) It is capable of blowing itself up. It uses this explosive force to jump from mountain to mountain. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Golem live up on mountains. If there is a large earthquake, these Pok é mon will come rolling down off the mountains en masse to the foothills below.
Generation III.Sapphire: Golem is known for rolling down from mountains. To prevent them from rolling into the homes of people downhill, grooves have been dug into the sides of mountains to serve as guideways for diverting this Pok é mon 's course.
Generation III.Emerald: It is said to live in volcanic craters on mountain peaks. Once a year, it sheds its hide and grows larger. The shed hide crumbles and returns to the soil.
Generation III.FireRed: It is enclosed in a hard shell that is as rugged as slabs of rock. It sheds skin once a year to grow larger.
Generation III.LeafGreen: Its boulder-like body is extremely hard. It can easily withstand dynamite blasts without taking damage.

Generation IV.Diamond: It sheds its hide once a year. Its boulderlike body is so tough, even dynamite can't harm it.
Generation IV.Pearl: It tumbles down mountains, leaving grooves from peak to base. Stay clear of these grooves.
Generation IV.Platinum: Even dynamite can't harm its hard, boulderlike body. It sheds its hide just once a year.
Generation IV.HeartGold: It sheds its skin once a year. The discarded shell immediately hardens and crumbles away.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: It is capable of blowing itself up. It uses this explosive force to jump from mountain to mountain.

Generation V.Black: Even dynamite can't harm its hard, boulderlike body. It sheds its hide just once a year.
Generation V.White: Even dynamite can't harm its hard, boulderlike body. It sheds its hide just once a year.
Generation V.Black 2: Even dynamite can't harm its hard, boulder-like body. It sheds its hide just once a year.
Generation V.White 2: Even dynamite can't harm its hard, boulder-like body. It sheds its hide just once a year.

Generation VI.X: It tumbles down mountains, leaving grooves from peak to base. Stay clear of these grooves.
Generation VI.Y: Even dynamite can't harm its hard, boulder-like body. It sheds its hide just once a year.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Golem live up on mountains. If there is a large earthquake, these Pokémon will come rolling down off the mountains en masse to the foothills below.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Golem is known for rolling down from mountains. To prevent them from rolling into the homes of people downhill, grooves have been dug into the sides of mountains to serve as guideways for diverting this Pokémon's course.

Generation VII.Sun: It fires rocks charged with electricity. Even if the rock isn't fired that accurately, just grazing an opponent will cause numbness and fainting.
Generation VII.Moon: Because it can't fire boulders at a rapid pace, it's been known to seize nearby Geodude and fire them from its back.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: It's grumpy and stubborn. If you upset it, it discharges electricity from the surface of its body and growls with a voice like thunder.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: It shoots large rocks that are charged with electricity. Tremendous electric shocks are flung out across the whole area of impact.
Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: It uses magnetism to accelerate and fire off rocks tinged with electricity. Even if it doesn't score a direct hit, the jolt of electricity will do the job.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: It uses magnetism to accelerate and fire off rocks tinged with electricity. Even if it doesn't score a direct hit, the jolt of electricity will do the job.

Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It sheds its hide once a year. Its boulder-like body is so tough, even dynamite can't harm it.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It tumbles down mountains, leaving grooves from peak to base. Stay clear of these grooves.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: The rocklike shell is shed each year. The cast-off shell then crumbles, reverting to a mass of soil, which can be spread across fields to promote crop growth.

Generation IX.Scarlet: It’s grumpy and stubborn. If you upset it, it discharges electricity from the surface of its body and growls with a voice like thunder.
Generation IX.Violet: It fires rocks charged with electricity. Even if the rock isn’t fired that accurately, just grazing an opponent will cause numbness and fainting.

Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Evolve Graveler ( Alolan Form ) Pokémon Bank ( Kantonian Form )
